task.title: Create a Shape-Builder Grid
task.shortdesc: Numerous Inkscape projects will benefit from the creation of a simple grid by which you can more easily and accurately draw paths. Creating a shape-builder grid in Inkscape can best be accomplished with a simple bezier line path and the Interpellation tool.

prereq.p: Before you begin, you will need the following software installed on your computer:

step.cmd: Select the Pen path tool, and draw a straight vertical line.

substep.cmd: To draw a perfectly straight line, press and hold the Control key (Windows/PC and Mac), and click onto the canvas where you want to start the line.
On Windows/PC, right-click to release the pen from the canvas and complete the line. On a Mac, press Shift-Enter to release the pen from the canvas and complete the line.

stepresult.p: Your line should resemble this output:

step.cmd: Duplicate the line by selecting the path and pressing Control-D (Windows/PC) or Command-D (Mac).
Move the duplicated line by pressing and holding control-Shift, while dragging the line with your mouse or trackpad to the opposite side of the canvas.
In the top bar menu, select Extensions Generate from Path Interpolate Between Paths .
In the Interpolate Between Paths dialog box, select the Live preview options, so you can decide how many lines to create inbetween your two existing lines.
Select the Split paths into segements of equal lengths and choose the values that will best serve your design needs for the Exponent and Interpolation steps options.

stepresult.note: If you select all of the lines, you can see how Inkscape has grouped the paths into 3 distinct groups: 2 lines and 1 interpolated set of line paths.

step.cmd: Since we need to create a grid shape with these line paths, we need to ungroup them into individual paths. Select all of the paths, right-click the selection, and select Ungroup.

stepresult.p: The resulting selection should render the lines as distinct paths.

step.cmd: Select all of the line paths and press Control-G (Windows/PC) or Command-G (Mac) to group them as one unified group of paths.
Duplicate this same selection of the grouped paths by pressing Control-D (Windows/PC) or Command-D (Mac).
You need to rotate this duplicated selection to create a grid, so click once more onto the selected group to toggle the rotation arrow tools.

stepresult.p: You should now see curved bi-directional arrows at the four corners of the group.

step.cmd: To rotate the duplicated group, press and hold Alt-Control, while pressing one of the corner arrows to rotate the grouped lines 90 degrees.
Based on your design goals, you can duplicate and modify this basic grid to include more grid lines at different angles, or consider alternative grids such as the example below.
